nodes.bodyText: Can these change over time? If they are fixed, they should be properties rather than Channels.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -114,46 +112,57 @@ Available device options are shown in thing properties.

nodes.bodyText: Unlike my assumption, and thus the initial implementation as properties, it seems to be quite common that individual device options are swapped or deactivated during operation (as communicated by users).
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: The readme states, these are read only.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -833,6 +849,100 @@
 		<state readOnly="true"/>
 	</channel-type>
 
+	<channel-type id="is_preheater" advanced="true">
+		<item-type>Switch</item-type>
+		<label>Preheater</label>
+		<description>Preheater option installed</description>
+		<category>Switch</category>
+		<state readOnly="false"/>

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure if I understand your comment correctly, but as stated above these channels are NOT meant to be read only
